message.content:
1. The study involved a double-blind phase.
2. Lurasidone was used in the study.
3. A placebo was used in the study for comparison.
4. Lurasidone significantly delayed time to relapse compared with placebo.
5. The significance of the delay was determined using a log-rank test.
6. The p-value from the log-rank test was 0.039.
7. The delay reflected a 33.7% reduction in risk of relapse.
8. The Cox hazard ratio was used to measure the reduction in risk of relapse.
9. The Cox hazard ratio was 0.663.
10. The 95% confidence interval for the Cox hazard ratio was 0.447–0.983.
11. The p-value associated with the Cox hazard ratio was 0.041.

messages.content:
Statement: In the double-blind phase, lurasidone significantly delayed time to relapse compared with placebo (log-rank test, p=0.039), reflecting a 33.7% reduction in risk of relapse (Cox hazard ratio (95% confidence interval), 0.663 (0.447–0.983); p=0.041).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
